pageContext.claim: “Great unity in the Republican Party. Want to, once and for all, put an end to stoppable crime and drugs! Border Security and Wall. No doubt!”
pageContext.analysis: Trump's demand for wall funding had split the Republican party, especially in the Senate. A day later, a Democratic proposal to end the shutdown without wall funding earned more votes than the Republican proposal, indicating the GOP caucus was fracturing. Two days later, Trump agreed to reopen the government.
